content.title: Tea Development Scheme
content.details: The scheme “Tea Development Scheme” was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya to continue the experimental plantation of tea and to find the possibility of growing tea economically as well as on a commercial scale. Further, seedlings are raised in the experimental station and distributed free to farmers.
benefits: Seedlings are offered for sale at the rate ₹1/- per tea seedling and one-time financial assistance at the rate ₹10,000/- per hectare.
PP chemicals, equipment, brush cutters, tea harvesters, etc. on sale at the rate of 50% subsidy.
eligibility: The applicant/farmer should be a resident of Meghalaya.
The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in Agriculture, possessing own or leased land of not exceeding 2 Ha/family.
documents_required: Documents proof of possessing own or leased land

faqs.question: What is the key objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To carry out experimental plantation of tea for the possibility of finding ways to grow tea economically and in a commercial scale as well. Raising seedlings in the experimental station for distribution to farmers. Encouraging Organic Certification on a cluster-based approach. Training and capacity building to Tea growers.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya has launched this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the type of assistance/service?
faqs.answer: Providing tea seedlings, bio-pesticides, bio-fungicides, plant protection equipment, brush cutters, harvesters’ etc. One-time financial assistance @ ₹10,000/- per hectare and training and capacity building are also provided to the Tea growers.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of assistance?
faqs.answer: (i) Sale @ ₹1/- per seedling (ii) One-time financial assistance @ ₹10,000/- per hectare. (iii)50% subsidy on bio-fertilizers bio-pesticides, bio-fungicides, plant protection equipment, brush cutters, harvesters, etc.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers engaged in agriculture, possessing own or leased land of not exceeding 2 Ha/family can apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper along with supported land documents through the nearest Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Horticulture Circle.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: Bonafide farmers on first come first serve basis.

faqs.question: Whom to contact?
faqs.answer: District Horticulture Officer and Horticulture Development Officer.
